body:
Comment 7: 
The syntax is bad - it looks like a shell command
and acts like a shell command even if it is a function call.
But also I don't want function calls.

My example was bad.  This is what I really want:

#cgo pkg-config: cairo

and that means let cgo run pkg-config however it needs to
(and it knows how) to learn how to get at the cairo package.

If cgo ever supported static libraries then maybe

#cgo pkg-config: --static cairo

but --libs would never be there.  That's something cgo would
during one of its invocations of the pkg-config command but
not something that the user would ever specify.

Russ
